title: This Eight-Acre Compound in California’s Napa Valley Comes With a Winery Permit
text:
Listing of the Day

Location: St. Helena, California

Price: $12 million

This eight-acre compound in the heart of California’s Napa Valley wine country offers a pool, three acres of private vineyards and an 8,000-gallon winery permit that transfers with the purchase.

"It’s very hard to get a winery permit," listing agent Agi Smith said. "It can take several years."

Normally, you have to have a "minimum of 10 acres," she said, but this property, which has eight, was grandfathered in.

"It’s a quintessential Napa Valley property," Ms. Smith said. "Everything about Napa is about living outdoors and farm to table."

"They really embrace that concept on this property," she said, with a rich array of gardens and public rooms that open to the pool and spa and a fully equipped outdoor kitchen. "It’s just an extraordinary estate."

More: Ultra-Modern House in the Heart of Canada’s Okanagan Valley Wine Country

The indoor kitchen features Sub-Zero, Bosch and Gaggenau appliances, a huge island and limestone counters.

Ms. Smith described the 2007 house as "timeless—it’s a piece of art that just won’t age."

In addition, the owners, who sited and built the house, "are huge art collectors and the walls in the house have spectacular spaces for art," Ms. Smith said.

The lower-level winery and tasting room "would make the most magnificent wine cellar, and you could make wines off your own vineyards," she said.

The estate now has about three acres of Cabernet Sauvignon and Cabernet Franc vines.

Surrounded by a state park and large parcels of privately held land, the property is "totally private," Ms. Smith said. "You can’t see the house from the road."

"The views are amazing," she added. "It’s all vineyards and mountain views."

More: Wine-Producing Equestrian Estate in California’s Napa Valley

Stats

The 9,324-square-foot house has three bedrooms, three full bathrooms and two partial bathrooms. It sits on an eight-acre lot. There is also a guest house with one bedroom, one bathroom, and a kitchen and living room.

Amenities

Amenities include a pool and spa, a private vineyard and winery, a fully equipped outdoor kitchen with Viking appliances and a stone fireplace, and robust gardens with fresh fruits and vegetables and walnut and olive trees.

From Penta: Great Escapes: The Rustic Luxury of the Scottish Highlands

Neighborhood Notes

"It’s just minutes to St. Helena," and you’re also close to the small city of Calistoga, Ms. Smith said.

"St. Helena has a lot of wineries, but it’s mainly known for its downtown Main Street," she said. "It’s a quaint little town with cute restaurants and boutique clothing and jewelry shops."

The city of Napa is about 20 minutes from the property, she said.

Agent: Agi Smith, Engel & Völkers Napa
